turns.content:
Use the improvements mentioned above on the OKR recap I am sending to you and make an optimized version:

Brief summary: O: 20% completion K1: 60% completion K2: 15% completion K3: 40% completion

Recap of your progress on OKRs:
K1: v2 of the design is complete but the following adjustments are needed: making the different states of the feature clearer and more obvious, taking into account different uses of AT (for example: students learning from multiple teachers, 1 account for multiple kids learning on AT with the same teacher, exam preparation students, non-language learners, etc)
K2: Goals and strong ideas for the SOP to create all the lesson material need review. I created content for about 5% of A1 level but what took more time was thinking about the SOP to work around the content limitations of the AI. If good, i can experiment on making it more efficient and start using Luisa's course structure (her K1) to create as much content before the end of the day.
K3: I made a graphic explaining how I structured my workflow with the AI. Currently the AI has a hard limit of 300~400 characters for replies per chat (SEO team has the same problem). The solution is to first make the AI create the outline and create content in blocks and when relevant as it to "continue previous message" to get more.

Optimized version:

Brief summary: O: 20% completion K1: 60% completion K2: 15% completion K3: 40% completion

Recap of your progress on OKRs:

* K1: v2 of the design is complete but adjustments are needed to make the different states of the feature clearer and more obvious. Need to take into account different uses of AT, such as students learning from multiple teachers, exam preparation students, and non-language learners.
* K2: Goals and strong ideas for the SOP need review. Created content for about 5% of A1 level, but more time was spent thinking about the SOP to work around AI content limitations. Can experiment on making it more efficient and start using Luisa's course structure (her K1) to create more content.
* K3: Created a graphic explaining my workflow with the AI. Currently the AI has a hard character limit for replies per chat, but the solution is to make the AI create an outline and create content in blocks, and use "continue previous message" where relevant.
